translation:

"how can we still talk about data privacy and informational self-determination in the age of social media, when we're sharing our personal information like no one else? ü§î #dataprivacy #privacy #socialmedia"

in this post, i'm questioning the irony of people sharing their personal information on social media platforms, while also claiming to care about data privacy and informational self-determination. the hashtags #datenschutz (data privacy) and #privatsph√§re (privacy) are commonly used in germany to discuss these topics. by using the phrase "wie kann man noch" (how can we still), i'm expressing my criticism of the fact that people often claim to care about their privacy, but then share intimate details of their lives online.
